body.p:
We are approaching
the end of the year A year marked by greater vicissi
tudes in the affairs of motions than nay in which
we have lived. Any indeed of which we have read
Such great events have marked epochs or made them!
And another to be added to the numbers is the un-
weaning? consistency of my correspondence to you.
Indulge your repeated failures in replying to my
communications. I trust the old year will blot out
all your delinquencies & that the New Year will
bring with it punctual offerings to the Shrine of
friendship. I have a great respect for your Clothes
& for your talents but a much greater for my
dignity & truly my self love waxes ? when
I find you allow my responses to be like
Angels visits. Your desire that memories of the past
shall satisfy our hopes for the future, is rather unreasonable
& not meted out with that spirit of generosity which
we are led to expect from one of your high inspira
tions. I therefore Good friend (although I may grant
you got not value received for your letters, feel it
incumbent on my dignity to inform you that if you
allow my letters to lie so long on the shelf unanswered
I shall cast out all remembrances of past friendship
& think of our friendship as a thing that was not.

But badinage aside tell me good friend in sober earnest
why is it that I never hear from you but through the
Occident & through malevolent reports which tell me that
you are woefully disappointed in my character & the
esteem you have expressed, exists no longer because
forsooth I cannot see with your eyes or read with
your interpretations. This latter reason I cast from me
as unbecoming both your religion & your mind for however
we may desire our friends to view things as we do
we do not banish them from our esteem because they
cannot think as we do. You I know value the substance
not the shadow & as I retain the former will not
discard me because I lop off those discrepancies which
mar the beauty of our Holy religion—

My Cousin Mr Moise returned much pleased with his knowledge
of you personally & was pleased to find such liberall sentime
nts expressed by one so thoroughly versed in the elements
of our faith, The fault of American Jews originates in
their defective domestic education, religion with them
is but an appendage not an essential! They know they
are born Jews, but they are not early enculcated with
its purity & beauty; this has been the defect in all
our domestic education. This ever is becoming yearly
less glaring & parents are becoming more alive, to
the necessity of making the religion of the Jews a
primary not a secondary consideration.

I have noticed the deep importance you feel in
the establishment of schools where from the cradle

the infant Israelite will write with all his studies a knowledge
of Judaism & will have those doctrines of his faith laughed
by those who feel the importance of combining every
knowledge with a knowledge of his God & will find
no opposition to his understanding clearly those dogmas
which seem now so abstruse to them because other
views clash with them from the opinions gathered
from their Christian teachers. While writing I am
annoyed by the feu de fore? which ushers in the birth of
Christ; how inconsistent it appears to me that the
Birth of their Savior should be celebrated by the firing
of Canons & Guns as if it were a National Victory!
Marriages & deaths go on in our circle the latter by
far the most frequent for unlike our pristine parents
our (fancied) wants are so numerous that poor young
men are afraid to enter into a state which requires
such ample means to render it pleasant! This will be hand
ed you by my eldest son who goes on for business
not pleasure still I trust he will find time to be
acquainted with some of my friends. He is reserved to
strangers & like his mother his “light is hid under a
bushel.” S A & Jeff beg to be remembered. I should
like to introduce you to all my Jewels for like
the mothers of Israel they are all my wealth.
If this hurried scratch will meet with sufficient
attention, I shall be pleased with a reply for I would
not let Philip go without informing you however
? you have been that a son of mine was in
your city. Yrs truly but in haste
